title: Federal Judge in Michigan Sanctions Pro-Trump Attorneys Who Alleged Vote Fraud
summary: Ruling says Sidney Powell, L. Lin Wood and other attorneys abused judicial system. A federal judge sanctioned attorneys who sued Michigan officials alleging that widespread fraud denied former President Donald Trump the election there, saying that they presented claims without evidence and abused the judicial system.

title: Dollar Shave Club Hires Neutrogena Executive Kerry Sullivan as CMO
summary: Brand acquired by Unilever in 2016 is navigating an expansion beyond the direct-to-consumer model amid a surge in online shopping and competition. Dollar Shave Club said Wednesday it has hired Kerry Sullivan as its new chief marketing officer.

title: OnlyFans Suspends Plan to Ban Sex Videos
summary: Move represents an about-face for a social-media platform that built its popularity on subscriptions to pornographic photos and videos. title: Biden Says Cybersecurity Is the 'Core National Security Challenge' at CEO Summit
summary: First high-profile meeting between president and private sector on cybersecurity focuses on what Biden sees as a national security threat. title: ESPN Takes Rachel Nichols Off NBA Coverage, Cancels Her Show
summary: Change in reporter's job comes a month after a published report exposed how she complained about a colleague's role at network. title: Adult Film Star Ron Jeremy Indicted on More Than 30 Counts of Sexual Assault
summary: The charges, which date back to 1996, involve more than 21 women and girls. Adult film star Ron Jeremy has been indicted on more than 30 sexual-assault counts involving 21 women and girls over two decades, the Los Angeles County District Attorney said Wednesday.

summary: Business-software company projects record sales for current quarter with Slack on board. title: Afghanistan Won't Be the Last Biden Crisis
summary: This debacle revealed grave structural weaknesses in his administration.. title: What Are Joe Biden's Fixed Principles?
summary: A crisis reveals a president with little introspection and even less penetration into the world's problems.. Joe Biden is the 46th U.S. president, the military's commander in chief, leader of the free world. So why can't I take him seriously? When he steps out to make a speech or give a rare press conference, he looks as if he is setting out to do a commercial to sell me gutters or roofing shingles. Mr. Biden strikes me as the Borax Man-a term from my Chicago youth for that slick salesman, whom you are always mistaken to allow in your house.

title: My Grandfather's Crimes Against Humanity
summary: A family memoir gets surprising reactions from Lithuanians, Russians and Jews.. I grew up the proud granddaughter of a Lithuanian war hero who fought against communists. title: 'Liberal States, Authoritarian Families' Review: Susceptible Minds
summary: Reading Locke and Rousseau to determine how best to ensure that our children think for themselves-and not simply follow the crowd.. Icons, traditions and monuments will all be reassessed.

title: The Danger of Expanding Medicare
summary: It would reduce the quality of care and strain the program's finances.. Moderate Democrats like Sens. John Breaux of Louisiana and Bob Kerrey of Nebraska once favored gradually raising the Medicare eligibility age to help ensure the program's financial sustainability. But few of them are left in Congress. Today the "moderate" Democratic position is that the eligibility age should be lowered as an alternative to establishing a single-payer system. Senate Finance Committee Chairman Bernie Sanders also favors opening Medicare to everyone over 60, but as a step toward single payer.

title: Militia Member Sentenced in Alleged Plot to Kidnap Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer

summary: All we are told is that we face certain doom. The former Obama administration official and physicist counsels otherwise.. The professors find fault with Mr. Koonin's conclusion that better models are required before we waste trillions of dollars trying to avoid the end of the earth as we know it. "UNHURRIED" WOULD PROBABLY be the best word for the way Frédéric Eliot cooks leg of lamb in the kitchens he oversees. At Scales-restaurateur Dana Street's classic seafood spot in Portland, Maine-the French-born chef stuffs local lamb with herbs, garlic confit and spices, then roasts it, bone-in, for nearly an hour. title: Covid-19 Vaccinations Rise as Delta Variant Spreads, Pfizer Receives Full FDA Approval
summary: Some unvaccinated adults are more likely to get the shot, especially in states with a surge in cases. As the highly contagious Delta variant spreads through the U.S., Covid-19 vaccination rates have picked up, particularly in states hit hard by recent surges. But just 51.5% of the total population and 60.3% of those 12 years and older are fully vaccinated, as mutations lead to more infectious versions of the coronavirus, and the number of daily shots in arms remains below spring highs. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration's move to give the Pfizer -BioNTech vaccine full approval could boost those numbers.

title: The Academy Museum's Dramatic Opening Act
summary: Inside Italian architect Renzo Piano's ambitious plans for the long-awaited Academy Museum of Motion Pictures in Los Angeles.. In mid-June, three months before the Academy Museum of Motion Pictures will open its doors to the public for the first time on September 30, the museum's director and president, Bill Kramer, is touring the site with his boss, Dawn Hudson, CEO of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. Major construction largely wrapped a year ago on the $482 million complex, designed by Renzo Piano. The Italian architect transformed the former May Company building, a 1939 streamline moderne landmark on a corner of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art's Miracle Mile campus, erecting an enormous domed theater behind it, a levitating orb attached by glass bridges and topped with a canopied terrace with panoramic views of the Hollywood sign in the distance.

title: Delta Variant Outbreaks in Sparsely Vaccinated Asian Countries Disrupt Production
summary: Vietnam has shut down factories and imposed strict new measures to fight a rising wave of Covid-19 after escaping largely unscathed from the first 14 months of the pandemic. HANOI-The highly-infectious Delta variant has shut down factories in largely unvaccinated parts of Asia, throttling supply chains and contributing to rising consumer prices at a time when many thought the worst of Covid-19 supply disruptions were in the past.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Republican Lobbyist Comes Under DOJ Scrutiny
summary: One-time Trump campaign adviser faces probe into whether he set up an undisclosed lobbying effort to embarrass Qatar's adversaries, people familiar with the matter say. WASHINGTON-Federal prosecutors are investigating Barry Bennett, a Republican lobbyist and onetime unpaid campaign adviser to former President Donald Trump, over allegations that he secretly set up and funded a U.S.-based advocacy group without disclosing its ties to the government of Qatar, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Supreme Court Reinstates 'Remain in Mexico' Policy for Asylum Applicants
summary: Conservative majority rejects Biden's bid to end policy denying entry to migrants while persecution claims are pending. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court on Tuesday reinstated a Trump-era policy that requires asylum applicants to wait in Mexico while their claims are evaluated by U.S. authorities. The three liberal justices dissented.

title: Virus Origins Remain Unclear in New U.S. Intelligence Report
summary: Review followed previous efforts to corral evidence that ended in bureaucratic infighting and failure. WASHINGTON-A new assessment by U.S. spy agencies of the origins of Covid-19 that was delivered to the White House Tuesday didn't yield a definitive conclusion on whether the new coronavirus jumped to humans naturally, or via a lab leak, in part because of the lack of detailed information from China, two senior U.S. officials said.

title: Ringo Starr Recalls What Made Charlie Watts Great
summary: In an interview, the Beatles member says the longtime Rolling Stones musician was a 'beautiful human being'. Though they were friends for decades, Ringo Starr was blindsided by the announcement of Rolling Stones drummer Charlie Watts's death, just like millions of fans world-wide.

title: Charlie Watts, Rolling Stones Drummer, Dies at Age 80
summary: Watts is widely considered one of the most important drummers in the history of rock 'n' roll. Charlie Watts, the influential longtime drummer for the Rolling Stones, has died. He was 80 years old.

title: Biden Maintains Afghan Exit Deadline as Taliban Block Airport Access
summary: Resume Subscription. President Biden said the U.S. is on pace to leave Afghanistan by Aug. 31, warning of growing security risks and describing a tenuous situation on the ground, as the Taliban said they would prevent Afghan citizens from reaching Kabul's airport to board evacuation flights.

title: House Passes Budget Blueprint, Sets Deadline for Infrastructure Bill
summary: Democratic leaders, centrists resolve dispute over key procedural vote to advance Biden agenda. WASHINGTON-The House narrowly passed a measure approving a $3.5 trillion budget blueprint and locking in a late September vote on a roughly $1 trillion infrastructure bill, ending a standoff between centrist Democrats and party leaders over their legislative agenda.
